channel.title: patents on Kuldeep Singh
channel.description: Recent content in patents on Kuldeep Singh

item.title: Testing the Ground: Reflections on 2024 and the Road Ahead for 2025
item.author: thinkuldeep@gmail.com (Kuldeep Singh)
item.description: As we bid farewell to 2024 and welcome 2025, it’s a time to reflect on the lessons learned, both good and challenging, and prepare for the opportunities ahead. Not everything went as planned, but each experience has been a stepping stone toward growth. Intelligence, after all, evolves through adaptation, and 2024 was undeniably a year where Artificial Intelligence (AI) took center stage. Looking ahead, 2025 promises to bring more focused implementation, balancing AI advancements with broader digital modernization efforts.

item.title: Patent Granted: Square orientation for stereoscopic rendering
item.author: thinkuldeep@gmail.com (Kuldeep Singh)
item.description: In our day-to-day work, we often create methods, processes, approaches, or features to address specific needs and challenges. Sometimes, these solutions turn into significant innovations, even if we don’t immediately recognize them as such. This is also true in our professional work setup, where we may invent without fully realizing it. I’m thrilled to share that a new patent has been granted to Lenovo for their groundbreaking work in the ThinkReality XR product line, and I am honored to be a co-inventor on this work.

item.title: Patents
item.author: thinkuldeep@gmail.com (Kuldeep Singh)
item.description: This listing includes patent applications that are pending as well as patents that have already been granted by the United States Patent and Trademark Office (USPTO). CONCURRENT RENDERING OF CANVASES FOR DIFFERENT APPS AS PART OF 3D SIMULATION This invention focuses on rendering multiple 2D mobile apps simultaneously in XR devices, arranged within a 3D spatial layout. This browser does not support PDFs. Please download the PDF to view it: Download PDF.
